A Half-Life a játékok Ponyvaregénye. A 90-es évek egyik csodája. Minden idők egyik legsikeresebb FPS-e. A Valve aranytojást szaró tyúkja. A játék, ami sosem válik unalmassá. A játék amely mindig örökzöld marad. Az életérzés, amely megtapasztalása nélkül nem szabad meghalni. 10/10!!!
This game offers the greatest story telling in all FPS game. A true masterpiece in gaming.

Excelente enredo. A história de Half Life me fascina.
Nesse jogo, assume-se o papel de Gordon Freeman, um cientista com Ph.D em Física Teórica que trabalha no laboratório Black Mesa. Gordon é encarregado da manipulação de um cristal desconhecido em um experimento no setor de materiais anômalos. Durante o experimento ocorrem várias explosões e vários portais são abertos em diversos locais do complexo Black Mesa. Os portais acabam trazendo criaturas estranhas que vão acatando as pessoas e promovendo o caos no complexo. Gordon faz uso de diversas armas, adquiridas no decorrer do jogo, e da sua HEV Suit para tentar escapar do complexo. Além de ter que lutar contra as criaturas dos portais, ele ainda enfrenta soldados e agentes enviados para eliminar quaisquer evidências do incidente.
Em determinado momento, Gordon encontra alguns cientistas que o convencem a ser teletransportado para Xen, local distante no espaço de onde estariam vindo as criaturas pelos portais. Eles altertam Gordon que algo (Nihilanth) em Xen estaria mantendo os portais abertos e precisava ser eliminado. Gordon vai a Xen e acaba por derrotar Nihilanth.
O jogo termina com Gordon sendo teletransportado para um elevador e ficando frente a frente com um cara de terno e com uma maleta na mão (Gman). Gman fala muitas coisas confusas mas deixa entender que está no controle dos acontecimentos e que estaria contente com os serviços de Gordon e gostaria de contratá-lo.
Recomendo assistirem no youtube as traduções dos diálogos e resumos da história de Half Life para compreensão do game, especialmente discursso de Gman no final do jogo.
Jogar Half Life é o mínimo que um gamer que deseja conhecer a franquia deve fazer. Em Half Life temos o acidente em Black Mesa, o maior acontecimento da história da franquia, praticamente tudo no enredo está direta ou indiretamente ligado a este acontecimento.

I really liked this game!!
The only 2 bad things I have to say is it was a little repetitive, and sometimes confusing/hard at some points.
Otherwise a great game, and I can't wait to get into Half Life 2!!!

HALF-LIFE, el primer juego de la empresa estadounidense [b]Valve[/b] y que creó una legión de fans, en el momento de su publicación en 1998 (más de 15 años ya), sorprendió a propios y extraños del género de los FPS, pues hasta aquel momento, ningún FPS había contado con una historia tan absorbente e intrigante como el juego que nos ocupa.

[h1][b]HISTORIA[/b][/h1]
La acción del juego se desarrolla en el "Black Mesa Research Facility" (claro homenaje al ÁREA 51), donde se llevan a cabo todo tipo de experimentos, pero algo sale mal y de repente, las instalaciones de Black Mesa se ven asoladas por una invasión alienígena, entonces el gobierno de los E.E.U.U. decide enviar a los militares para acabar con dicha amenaza, e incluso silenciar a todo testigo de lo allí acontecido. Eres Gordon Freeman, un joven y prometedor científico asignado al equipo del experimento fallido, desde que este sale mal, te ves obligado a colaborar con los guardias de seguridad y otros científicos que encuentras por el camino, así como a luchar contra militares y todo tipo de aliens que han invadido BLACK MESA para sobrevivir. 

[h1][b]DESARROLLO[/b][/h1]
En [b]Half-Life[/b] la dificultad va aumentando de forma gradual, sin desesperar en ningún momento, pero no es un juego fácil y si queréis un reto de verdad, probar a jugarlo en el mayor nivel de dificultad la segunda vez que lo juguéis, este es un FPS de la vieja escuela de finales de los 90, eso quiere decir que no hay coberturas desde las que matar a todo enemigo que aparezca en la pantalla, si os quedáis agazapados, los enemigos irán a por vosotros y no duraréis ni un suspiro.

[h1][b]MOTOR GRÁFICO / DISEÑO ARTÍSTICO[/b][/h1]
Half-Life hace uso del motor gráfico Goldsource, una versión personalizada de Valve del Quake engine, motor de ID Software. Aunque han pasado 15 años ya, el estilo gráfico del juego no decepciona a nadie, y es que con los años, Valve, ha ido dotando al motor del juego de nuevas características, como los modelos High Definition portados directamente de la versión Dreamcast, las texturas detalladas y la posibilidad de poder cargar contenido personalizado sin tener que sobrescribir los archivos originales del juego, un ejemplo de esto, lo podéis encontrar en mi guía para aplicar al juego texturas detalladas y modelos Ultra Definition, del MOD Half-Life GOLD y del grupo Trusty Crowbar respectivamente, lo que supone mejorar el juego a cuotas inimaginables, cuando salió el juego allá por 1998.

[h1][b]LEGADO / MODS[/b][/h1]
Gearbox Software se encargó de portarlo a PS2 y a Dreamcast, así como de desarrollar las dos expansiones oficiales de PC, Opposing Force y Blue Shift, además de Decay, la tercera expansión oficial que salió junto a la versión de PS2 y portada a PC en 2008 por modders europeos.

Half-Life aún hoy en día, tiene una legión de modders increíble, que aún siguen creando MODs, modelos, música y más para este fantástico juego y sus expansiones, además, sin este juego, nunca habríamos conocido Counter Strike o Day of Defeat, actualmente son juegos oficiales de la compañía pero empezaron siendo MODs de Half-Life, u otros como Afraid of Monsters y tantos otros que hay que me resulta imposible enumerarlos todos en este análisis, un buen lugar para consultar/conseguir MODs para Half-Life, es la web [b]Mod DB[/b], donde podéis encontrar todo tipo de material.

[h1][b]BANDA SONORA / SONIDOS FX[/b][/h1]
La música suena en los momentos adecuados, y eso en mi opinión, le otorga otro punto a su favor, pues los fantásticos efectos de sonido de enemigos, personajes secundarios, armas y demás, son suficientes para crear la ambientación necesaria en un juego de este tipo, cuando avancéis por un almacén y no oigáis nada de nada, estar atentos al más mínimo ruido, advertidos quedáis.

Desde la implementación de [b]STEAM MUSIC,[/b] Valve regala la "Banda Sonora Original" del juego, el único requisito para obtenerla es tener el juego en vuestra biblioteca de Steam.

[h1][b]COLECCIONABLES / EXTRAS / REJUGABILIDAD[/b][/h1]
Half-Life no tiene objetos que encontrar o salas ocultas como otros FPS contemporáneos, es acción pura y dura por doquier, en cuanto a su rejugabilidad, el mayor aliciente es terminar el juego en el mayor nivel de dificultad, todo un reto sólo apto para los maestros del género. 

Os recomiendo que primero juguéis con los gráficos originales o con los modelos High Definition y que después probéis los modelos Ultra Definition y texturas detalladas de mi guía, de este modo, apreciaréis mucho mejor todos los cambios realizados.

[h1][b]VALORACIÓN FINAL[/b][/h1]
Un FPS que no puede faltar en vuestra biblioteca de Steam, no sólo por ser el primer juego de Valve y uno de los mejores FPS de la década de los 90, su legado o su increíble legión de fans, simplemente tienes que tenerlo y jugarlo porque es uno de esos juegos que hoy en día están considerados como un "IMPRESCINDIBLE", tienes que tenerlo.

[h1][b]NOTA: 10 sobre 10[/b][/h1]


[h1][b]APORTACIONES DE RASKAIPIKA[/b][/h1]
Para hacer mas satisfactoria vuestra experiencia con Half-Life, os dejo el enlace a las guías que he creado:

[b]Traducción OFICIAL de Half-Life mejorada + Menú  principal / in-game mejorado + Contenido no incluido de Further Data Disc:[/b]
[url=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=269826413[/url] 

[b]Modelos Ultra Definition + Texturas Detalladas para Half-Life:[/b]
[url=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=271014050[/url]

[b]Expansión OFICIAL Half-Life: Decay + Traducción (Textos y Voces):[/b]
[url=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=270044675[/url]

[b]Demo OFICIAL Half-Life: Uplink + Traducción (Textos y Voces):[/b]
[url=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=270826165[/url]

[b]Port Half-Life: Dreamcast + Traducción (Textos y Voces):[/b]
[url=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=270797050[/url]

I loved this game in 1998 and I still do. The athmosphere is still dense and mainly carried by the sound effects and the incredible story-line.  To be honest the GFX and Textures are outdated and look a bit washed out but even after sixteen years people play online and slaughter each other on "crossfire" and "stalkyard". 

If you expect an overload of FX and HD-graphics entobed in some COD manner your are about to be disapointed and probably are way to young to know what impact this game had back in the days. 

After i got my copy of it today i must admit i had a fit of rage about the Content-Lock-Violence-Filter that made killed "Barneys" just sit down.  But a few minor corrections added to the configs made me happy again. Probably there are Hi-Res textures somewhere on the internet to solve even the looks of it.
A true masterpiece. Even though it's  from 1998 and the graphics are a tad old it doesn't bother you in the least. The gameplay is superb and very challenging. Would recommend it to anyone.

This game is amazing. Do I even have to say it?

However,the game ages well,but not in some parts.
The gameplay CAN and WILL feel like trial and error at times. For example,in the chapter We've got hostiles,you need to dodge lasers so sentries don't hit you. The lasers are SO close togther,so it took me a few tries.

Also,it feels like some of the enemies will not die. Like the soldiers or some of the aliens. I think that they are wearing five bulletproof-vests.

Also,the animations of the people are crap. You could make a robot walk better.

If you can excuse the game for its age,it is an AMAZING game.

I would rate it higher,but if you like older games,this is a must.

I bought this game due to there being a massive hype about it. I respect the fact that for its time (1998), it was/is? a spectacular game, with still many fans. Unfortunatly for me, I only found out about Half-Life when I downloaded Steam in 2013 :-{. I bought it to give it a try but I really can't get into it and it actully feels like a chore to play. The graphics are dated, ok some would say "it's not about the graphics" but really, it gave me a headache everytime I tried to play. The story? maybe I didn't play long enough for it to start making sense but it didn't immerse me at all.

The ship has sailed before I even knew there was a ship. For anyone thinking of getting this in 2014, I would probably give Half-Life 1 a miss and just try out Half-Life 2. Valve usually do Half-Life Complete Packs with all Half-Life games. When on sale  it is usually a very good price so if your still intrigued about it, do that!
It's not about the graphics. THIS GAME IS AWESOME! Lots of action and puzzle solving, and a very long storyline based around science fiction. A must-have for Sci-Fi fans!

around the time this game was released there were two types of video game story types. There was The Doom style, you know that stuff you mistake for credits in between blowing shit up. 

There was MGS, which felt the need to beat you with exposition until you began to feel like you were a Horse. who was dying. 

But narrative, true narrative, is not blowing shit up or exposition. It is what half life does. Storytelling through gameplay. It is not a simple shooting gallery, nor is it a movie where you have to do shit to get past the commercials. It is a game where gameplay and story are inseperable. Half-Life would be dull as a film. And what would it be without the G-Man? I had never played this game before, but I had heard of it. everyone has. It is considered the best of 90's PC gaming(well, it and Deus Ex.) It nails gameplay and storytelling. the tale is compelling, with action, suspense, and a hidden element of mystery.
cóż jestem wielkim fanem całej serji half-life i szczerze polecam tą grę każdemu kto ceni sobie klasykę w takiej postaci

Trial and error gameplay; seeing your head fly off when you die; falling through platforms that were once solid in a previous life;  the game telling you Gordon has no more grenades when he has one in his hand; AI blocking doors, getting stuck behind walls, and missing targets to hit you when you are on their side; scripted scenes that occour when you are out of range to see them; a confusing final boss that will make you question if you are actually damaging him; repetitive enemies; lackluster music; malicious ladder physics; questionable physics in general; topped with a minimalstic and anticlimatic credits seqence; these are the reasons why I call "Half-Life" "Half-Finished".

The survivalist vibe is implemented well, but if you want that, I would reccommend just about any other action game ever, including Half-Life 2.
Obra maestra

Yes, but get Half-Life: Source for an updated graphical appearance and more enjoyable fights.

I still remember when my brother first played this version though, the zombies still gave me the hebie-jebies...

Half-Life is a throwback game like Doom yet has it's own uniqueness and properties that set it apart and make it a classic. Great storyline, lots of gameplay, tons of enemies, and plenty of fun. It's an all around time waster that will make you feel like your time wasn't wasted. Highly reccommended to fans of all game types.

This game sucks. I don't know why there is such a huge following. Everything kills you in seconds and it's impossible to keep your health high enough to avoid it. I don't think Valve should worry about finishing (or starting) the third installment and just stick to Portal and L4D.

I bought the Half-Life complete pack during the 2014 summer sale, and can't recommend Half life enough. If you can get past the dated graphics, this is an absolutely stunning game. It doesn't have much more to it than the story mode, as multiplayer servers are dead, but it is a really long story mode (I still haven't completed it yet.) It is also suited well for speedruns, so if that is your thing, get exited.

I say you should get the Half Life Complete bundle and be happy.

I can't even start to tell you what a master piece Half-Life is..... I highly recommend this game for ANYONE! Most modern gamers shy away from Half-Life because of it's 1998 graphics but if you look past that you'll find an amazing experience... You play as Gordon Freeman a scientist working at the Black Mesa facility when an experiment that you're a part of goes terribly wrong and opens up a portal linking Earth and Xen (Zen) from there on, hoardes of alien's invade the place and you're goal is SURVIVING... Game play wise it flows well and I don't have any complaints about the game play EXCEPT their is way to much jumping in this game... This is just a minor complaint I did love the parkour puzzles because they worked in the game flawlessly as you're traveling through the complex.... The parkour PUZZLES were fantastic but navigating through them proved to be a little difficult and taxing at times... But don't overlook this game because of this minor problem because you'll be missing out on an amazing game! I also like Half-Life because it had great interactive story telling... I mean, sure you could just ignore the scientist and fly right through the game but then you would miss out on the extraordinary experience which is really what Half-Life is all about (and be completly lost and confused by the end of it aswell)... Half-Life has a great beginning even though it is a little boring but I loved that first 20 minutes of strolling through the office and talking to you're co-scientist because it gets you involved with the game.... Half-Life has great narrative pacing which you just don't see in games anymore today..... I also loved Half-Life because the enviroments are so detailed... I have played Half-Life three times already and I still keep finding new room's and compartments in Black Mesa that have ammo and health packs in them.... But although the setting and events of the game are entirly fictional, the detail in first person shooter's had never felt so absorbingly real at the time that it was realised..... So we can blame it for every other thing done in the name of "realism" every since.... I'm talking about Call of Duty, Battlefield, and all the other shooter games that now control 80% of the freakin industry today.... Which I don't hate shooters but Half-Life used it for innovation in gaming, shooters today could care less about quality as long as they're stealing your money.... So just to recap Half-Life has an incredible interactive story, fantastic enviroments with impeccable details, and has suprises and jump scares that you won't see coming even if it is you're second or third time playing the game.... Half-Life is only $9.99 on Steam and if you haven't already played it YOU NEED TO! Even if you aren't in to FPS games and especially if you are.
Хорошая

I daresay it was also the missing half of the gaming industry at the time, filling gaps that console titles could not manage to.

I give Half-Life a 9/10 and recommend any one who took the time to read this review to go check out this unmissable classic title if you have not already!

UWAGA - RECENZJA JEST PISANA Z PERSPEKTYWY STEAMOS+LINUX.

Pierwszy produkt Valve Software który składa sięz byłych pracowników Microsoftu oparaty o zmodyfikowany silnik idTech Quake (czyt. Kłejk) - GoldSrc przenosi nas do tajnego ośrodka badawczego Black Mesa.
Osobiście wcielamy się w doktora fizyki teoretycznej - Gordona Frimana, 
Niestaty, w wyniku nieudanego eksperymentu nt. teleportacji doszło do kompletniej katastrofy, wielu wybitnych naukowców straciło życie, a sam Gordon musi sam sobie radzić i uturować drogę ucieczki.

Grę zaprezentowano na targach E3 w 1997, została wydana 25 stycznia 2013 roku, przez graczy została bardzo ciepło przyjęta.
Jest prosta, nie ciągnie za rączke, łatwo się zgubić...i łatwo zginąć, ma urok.
nNasz niemówiący tajemniczy bochater przemierza zrujnowany ośrodek niczym z poapokaliptycznego świata - małego świata.
W wyniku sromotnej porażki naukowców nieznane istoty pozaziemskie zaczęły teleportować sięna teren ośrodka tworząc nowe kolonie - nowy dom.
Wszystko na Twojej drodze będzie próbowało Ci przeszkodzić w ucieczce i tylko w Tobie jest jedyna nadzieja - musisz zmienić to do czego zostało doprowadzone, a na jedyna pomoc jaką możesz liczyć to na pracowników ochrony, naukowców którzy przeżyli i łom który będzie ci towarzyszył niczym wierny kompan.

Gra oczarowuje swoją prostotą - wypadajace paczuszki z amunicją czy apteczki z trupów, czy z drewnianych pudeł, nienaganna fizyka, łom, oraz nasz bochater oryginalnie wchodzi po drabince, schludna i ładna grafika nadal po tylu latach ciesząca oko.
Wszystko w koło chce nas zabić, toksyny, prąd, para wodna, potwory, bosy... no ale co nas nie zabije, to HEV wzmocni.

Jest to najlepsza gra FPS jaką kiedykolwiek grałem, wciągająca na długie godziny.

The game is great, and repetitive at some points. It didn't age will, but I finished it. Hard game not any causal gamer who wants to finish it fast or easy. The story is somehow vague through the game but the ending blowed up my mind. The game mechanics are a bit old like ladders and some edges are annoying which may cause you to fall to your death.

7.5/10 interesting to play. The game is a bit old and there are some annoying parts, but the story is great so far and will continue in other HL games.

BTW, I kinda let my game running when I had things to do. So it is not 21hours, more like 16~17 hours.

самая крутая игра спасибо создателям за время провождения в этой игре
This game invented the modern single-player FPS.  If you haven't played this classic yet...then what's wrong with you?

Don't let the hype scare you away! Half-Life lives up to the expectations set by all of your crazy friends and those dudes on YouTube who talk about video games for a living. This games will take you on a wild ride, and is one of the coolest action games, thrilling survival horror games, and most well written stories I've seen in some time. $10 is quite a generous price so go ahead and get it if you have some spending money! Bare warning that, yes, it's an old game, so there is some loading issues and the textures aren't state of the art or anything, but does it need to be? Everything else that makes a game great is all here! You should be too! Come to Black Mesa, Mr. Freeman. Come and save the world.
The greatest of all FPS's. Definitely comparable to Ocarina of Time in terms of quality of play for its genre.

In 1998 this game started it all. The game that spawned sequels,followings,and other series (Portal). A classic FPS that has great graphics for the time. Can get a little creepy at times. You have a large arsonal of weapons to choose from. And you are in a giant science facility that just had an accident and now it is swarmin with aliens and marines that want to kill you. There is something new around every corner and you'll be wanting more when it ends. So Valve hurry up and MAKE HALF LIFE 3.

L'une des plus grandes claque vidéoludique de l'histoire.
LE FPS qui a tout révolutionné.

Apportant tant d'élements nouveaux, qu'il est difficile de tous les citer.
Le moteur est, pour l'époque, simplement magnifique. Le gameplay est juste parfait, avec des mécaniques de jeu qui ne sont toujours pas ridicule à l'heure actuelle.

Il s'agit du premier FPS vraiment scénarisé. 
Il offre un panel de situations et de diversités rarement atteint (ennemis, environnements, gameplay ...)

Aucun joueur de FPS digne de ce nom ne peut passer à côté de ce monument du jeu-vidéo.

15 ans après, Hlalf Life consitue un jeu toujours aussi exhaltant et effrayant, car l'amaiance joue un rôle prépondérant. Malgré quelques bugs graphiques et sonores, c'est un réel plaisir de rejouer encore et encore.

Eigentlich sollte es ein normaler Arbeitstag werden für Gordon Freeman, nunja beinahe,schließlich hantiert man nicht aller Tage mit Kristallen außerirdischer Herkunft.Allerdings geht etwas schief und die Black Mesa Forschungsanlage wird von Aliens überrannt,die das Wissenschaftspersonal dezimieren. Und als wenn eine Alien-Invasion noch nicht genug des Übels wäre will die Regierung auch noch alles vertuschen und schickt Soldaten aus um die Anlage zu „säubern“.
So kann man Half Life in etwa zusammenfassen und die Umsetzung dieser Story konnte den Titel damals(1998) von den üblichen Ballerbuden-Shootern absetzen. Zwar gibt es viele Schießereien,dennoch sind auch Jump and Run Elemente vorhanden und es wollen einige Rätsel in der Black Mesa gelöst werden. Auch steht Freeman nicht gänzlich alleine da,seine Wissenschaftlerkollegen helfen ihm aus wo sie können,wenn man sie im Gegenzug beschützt. Das Sicherheitspersonal der Black Mesa hingegen unterstützt Freeman auch im Kampf ,jedoch sind sie mit ihren Pistolen recht unterbewaffnet. Glücklicherweise findet Freeman im Laufe des Spiels genügend Waffen,die das Überleben erleichtern vom Brecheisen über Militärarsenal bis hin zu Energie- und Alienwaffen.
Die Geschichte von Half Life läuft komplett ohne Zwischensequenzen ab,man sieht die Welt also nur aus der Sicht von Gordon Freeman. Sein Aussehen wird zwar preisgegeben, jedoch bleibt Freeman während des gesamten Spieles stumm damit der Spieler sich besser mit dem Protagonisten identifizieren kann.
Bemerkenswert ist die Modding-Community von Half Life,so das man auch nach dem Beenden des Hauptspiels mit Mods wie beispielsweise Neil Manke's „They Hunger“ noch lange Spaß mit dem Titel haben kann. Desweiteren ist Half Life der Urvater von Mods wie Team Fortress und Counter-Strike die auch heute noch(wenn auch inzwischen als eigenständige Spiele)existieren.

In der deutschen Version darf nicht auf Menschen geschossen werden. Hier zeigt Half Life auf kuriose Weise wie stark damals noch zensiert wurde bei Dingen die mittlerweile einfach nur schräg erscheinen. Wissenschaftler und Wachpersonal setzen sich bei Beschuss kopfschüttelnd auf den Boden und das Militär wurde durch „Regierungsroboter“ ersetzt.
Glücklicherweise gibt es eine Möglichkeit,diese Änderungen rückgängig zu machen. Wer die „unmodifizierte“ Version spielen möchte, der sollte sich diesen Guide mal näher anschauen. Hat einwandfrei funktioniert!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=162403037

Best 3d first person shooter of all time 10/10 would bang

This game has become an all time favorite of mine. Great story, with a great atmosphere, and great gameplay. You play as a mute theoretical physicist by the name of Gordon Freeman, as you try to fight your way out of Black Mesa, a huge science facility, after a disaster that allows hostile aliens to enter our world. On top of that all, the military has taken notice of this invasion and sends troops in to contain all involved with the invasion, from aliens to harmless scientists. There's a pretty good reason the tagline for this game is "Run, Think, Shoot, Live." Although the game starts out a little slow, it never is boring, and once it gets going, it just keeps going. 10/10

It's a great game. Thats all there is to it. It has suspense, mystery, and no subtle amount of action. The game plays differently than other FPS's, because of the way that there are no jump cuts or cutscenes. Every event strings from one to another, and it results in a very rewarding experience.

My all-time favorite game, it is still amazing. The story, the gameplay, it’s all incredible. With lots of epic moments, I made a video showing off all the funny moments in Half Life along with Hl2.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3ac847NUk0

What is there to say that hasn't already been said. This game changed the landscape of storytelling in FPS games for decades to come. Seamlessly blending narrative elements into the gameplay while allowing players to tackle each encounter in a variety of ways, with excellent pacing in combat and downtime sections, this game is truly a masterpiece. If you haven't experienced this game yet, do yourself a favour and play through it.

This game is a masterpiece. I'm pretty sure I'm not the first to say that, but it really feels like one. Many things in this game make it what it is. First, the gameplay in this game is just marvelous, you can't feel closer to the game with its amazing mechanisms, shooting, jumping and everything you can do, it just feels right. It seems like it's really you that controls the game and that the final result, good or bad, is always the product of your moves. With great shooting and movement mechanisms, everything feels right.

Secondly, another thing you can't complain about this game: its story. The story of Half-Life, the one that gave birth to this amazing franchise, is just a beautiful piece of work. It fully accomplishes its mission to take you to another world. With the fact that, Gordon Freeman, the character which you control, is entirely in your possession feels like you are in this story and you have the power to change it. The game doesn't even have cutscenes so everything is seen from your point of view. The story is captivating; it treats the alien subject differently from most stories told on this subject. It contains a government trying to hide the alien-incident, a mysterious G-Man (the man who always watches you) and a chaotic man vs alien battlefield. Maybe after all, they're not what we thought... So many questions will fly around your head and will give you the desire to continue this mysterious story.

Thirdly, I have to talk about the graphics and the level design. Those both, like everything I said before, are just truly great. While the graphics may be considered "ugly" or "old", they are for me still beautiful even if this game is from 1998. The game has great details, textures and colors. Just imagine how it felt back in the days. For the level design, nothing as changed. What I mean by that, is even after more than a decade, the levels are still pure genius and are so well used that you need to think and to familiarize with them so you can use them as your advantage. I have to tell you that this game isn't like most of the games today and is longer, which is really nice, because you'll want this game to never end. There is also a multiplayer mode which can be fun, but, as you guessed it, is mostly dead. 

From a negative point of view, I don't have a lot to say. For the people that won't like the graphics, you can always buy the Black Mesa game, which is the same thing, but updated for the new generations (or old time fans). All I can say in the end, is that this game is a must!

Since I first heard about this game, I thought it is pretty cool and didn't really pay attention behind what's so great about Half-Life. Now, when I start playing it, I felt that this game has alot of riches and opprtunities that everyone will enjoy and no wonder Half-Life 1 has over 50 Game of the Year Awards.

First is for the pros, which this game has alot of them, the backstory and the characters behind the game are interesting, the gameplay is enjoyable and I have a good time with powerful weapons and the graphics are so breathtaking such as the canyon scene I saw, it was very unique and cool and for the planet Xen, I cannot believe that world was so out of place and drag me in behind the bizarre biological life that the aliens have. For the best part is that it doesn't feel the modern Call of Duty games such as Black Ops and Modern Warfare, its a different character as being a  scientist not a hardcore soldier that's how it is for this game, it's uniquely different and the Half-Life experience is totally out of this world.

Well, its not perfect, there are a few minor mistakes behind the game, sometimes when I interact with certain people and ask them to follow, they would rather stay in place and lose me whether I go and I became frustrated for it wastes time for my progression in the game. So, these were minor problems that Valve will improve throughout the new versions of Half-Life.

In the end, I got to say that this game definitely worths my time and money and I can't wait to enjoy other Half-Life expansions such as Opposing Force and Blue Shift. Also for its sequel, Half-Life 2 and it's remaining episodes, 1-2.

For the scale from 1 to 10, I'll give it a 10/10.
